intro: Commiphora cornii, commonly known as the African frankincense tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Burseraceae family. It is native to parts of sub-Saharan Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and produces a fragrant resin, which has been historically used in traditional medicine and incense. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a leathery texture. The tree typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and can reach heights of up to 10 meters.
